Description: Though too small for normal consumption, these grapes are suitable for making wine and medicine.
Filled with an alchemical mixture that gives off a balmy heat, this pouch provides a portable source of warmth, and is incidentally ideal for luring vampire bats.
The razor-sharp fang of a vampire bat, used to tally kills in your friendly contest with Alisaie.
Created by an Archon who devoted himself to the study of sustenance, this bread, infused with pulverized fish and vegetables, is extremely nutritious...assuming one can get past the taste.
A Crystal of Light believed to have belonged to Ardbert. Though it has lost its radiance, you would swear that a faint light still shines at its core, as if to remind you that hope never dies.
Legend says that Eorzea was once inhabited by a race of tiny creatures called brownies, and they would use the spores of this particular mushroom to paint their faces for battle.
The wooden tub entrusted to you at Buscarron's Druthers is now filled to the brim with cool river water.

If one were so inclined, the freshness of this egg could be checked by placing it in a container of water. Were it to lay on its side, it is almost certainly fresh. Should the egg float, however, it may be possessed by a voidsent and should be smashed with extreme prejudice.
A weathered brass earring fitted with a polished scarlet stone. A favorite of the forgetful Qiqirn Teteroon.
It takes almost a full year for a coeurl to grow its first whiskers. It took less than a minute to remove it.
An exceptionally large egg with a seemingly unbreakable shell. When it hatches, the baby adamantoise that emerges will likely be as large as a hound.
An order made out to Wineport vintner Shamani Lohmani.
Unlike carpenter's chisels which have flat heads, the bull-point chisel has a pointed one and is used by expert goldsmiths to perforate soft metals.
This tool is oft employed by goldsmiths or clockwork engineers to seize and manipulate minuscule pieces of wire.

A small-yet-heavy leather sack containing, presumably, roughly the amount of gil needed to purchase the tools requested by Marques. Any surplus coin could be considered commission owed to whichever party in the transaction is bright enough to claim it as their own.
By some manner of clockwork wizardry, this strange contraption can precisely measure and follow the twenty-four bells in a single turn of the sun.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
So cold, these cores are said to freeze the very air around them, making them perfect for cooling drinks on an especially hot day.
This bright blood-colored ore is thought to be a symbol of loyalty and honesty.
Over-aspected aether manifested into solid form.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The scars of war cover both back and front of this piece.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The scars of war cover all sides of this piece.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The outer layer has been repaired to appear good as new.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The outer shell has been repaired to appear good as new.
This translucent sac appears to be filled with thousands of tiny pearl-shaped eggs.
This melon-sized egg of the violent scalekin known as the anole is still slightly warm.

This highly flammable and caustic alcohol was originally used as an explosive for clearing tunnels, until one rather careless dwarf imbibed some by accident. After seeing him become horrendously drunk in a matter of moments, his friends emulated the feat, and before long, it was being produced in massive, massive quantities specifically for drinking purposes.
Some may wonder why in this day and age people still rely on such outdated forms of communication and have not upgraded to something more modern, such as smoke signals, for example.
This traditional decoration for Komra's annual celebration features an equally traditional Gogg pattern rendered in four colors.

An explosive crafted through generations of dwarven ingenuity. In the right hands they can uncover precious minerals hidden deep within the earth─in other hands they can make quite a pretty explosion.
A tightly sealed cask of locally brewed ale, earmarked for research purposes.
The latest invention of Garlond Ironworks, designed to analyse the signature of naturally occurring aether in a given location.
This frog-faced contraption is inert but appears otherwise undamaged.
A leather pouch filled with coin for purchasing a hefty sample of local ale.
A missive drafted in flowery quillmanship on fine parchment, adorned with the exquisite seal of House Durendaire.
This compact sack packed to the brim with dried cloudcrawler vines gives off a distinctively tantalizing aroma.
Although others have called this a trap, it appears to be nothing but a pouch with some small, pebble-like balls inside. It's probably best not to open it.
The latest invention of Garlond Ironworks, designed to analyse the signature of naturally occurring aether in a given location.
The latest invention of Garlond Ironworks, designed to analyse the signature of naturally occurring aether in a given location.

Considering that it is designed to advertise an art exhibition, this flyer strangely does not include any illustrations. Perhaps J'bhen Tia was unwilling to compromise his artistic vision by working with such humdrum materials as paper.
A component of the prototype warmachina piloted by the imperial forces.

Considering that it is designed to advertise an art exhibition, this flyer strangely does not include any illustrations. Perhaps J'bhen Tia was unwilling to compromise his artistic vision by working with such humdrum materials as paper.
Provisions meant for the IVth Imperial Legion's camp.
The surprisingly complete and miraculously immaculate costume favored by the Great Azuro (and his successive incarnations).
The heady fragrance of these flowers evokes an image of the picturesque coastline of Vylbrand.
Best not tell anyone else about this, lest you suddenly find yourself everyone's first choice in inter-world ferry services.
This red-hot piece of carbonized wood is a handy way to light a fire.
An ample quantity of smooth-to-the-touch yarn generously supplied to you by Marcelloix.
Tasty rice cakes made to celebrate Heavensturn.
This ornament may be suitable for some occasion, but unfortunately not the Starlight Celebration.
A crystalline agglomeration infused with the power of ice, said to grant snowmen temporary life.
Hang this circular band of evergreen branches adorned with berries, baubles, and pinecones on your door and your guests will surely get into the spirit of Starlight season.
A lightning shard that fairly dances with the concentrated energy it harbors. Handle with care.
Issued by Garlond Ironworks, this promissory note is intended for the purchase of the quantity of ceruleum specified thereupon.
An unadorned sack that you rescued from the streets of the Firmament.
This elegant, fragrant Nymeia lily was clearly grown with the utmost of care.
A treasured heirloom belonging to the chief's wife, kindly repaired by Konogg.
Covered in rust and riddled with dints, this machine lifeform has seen better days.
Tomes written in an unknown language, recovered from the depths of the Puppets' Bunker.
An assortment of machine parts serving unknown functions, recovered from the depths of the Puppets' Bunker.
A relic retrieved from the ancient ruins of Bozja.
A heavy container holding unknown contents, recovered from the depths of the Puppets' Bunker.
A compact tome for recording testimony and other observations gleaned from your investigation.
One never knows when a small portion of royal Allagan blood might come in handy, which is why G'raha Tia keeps this vessel about his person.
Woven from advanced fibers, this sack emits an electromagnetic charge that suppresses automaton function. Just kidding─it's just really, really big.
The automaton captive inside in this sack twitches fitfully.
Still warm from its brief time spent nestled beneath a broody chicken, this magnificent ovoid specimen is destined for use in the Hatching–tide celebrations.
A compact tome for recording testimony and other observations gleaned from your investigation.
A map likely revealing the location of treasure. It looks like it should, at any rate. ※Level 80 full party (8 players) recommended.

A faded map likely revealing the location of a teleportation portal leading to a hidden location...presumably filled with untold riches. It looks like it should, at any rate. ※Level 80 full party (8 players) recommended. ※Average item level 505 recommended.
When lit, this candle emits the odor of blood into the air. A favorite of voidsent hunters.
This ring is colored red with blood, although with whose is uncertain.
A large burlap sack filled with bundles of fragrant Nymeia potpourri.
The fluffy fleece of a wooly yak, shorn using the newfangled aetheromatic clipper.
Congratulations─you found the toy. Now, stop reading this and deliver it!
A tank of highly refined, Garlean military-grade ceruleum.
A mechanical part used in a heretofore unseen type of magitek weapon.
A bundle of tattered garments worn in ancient Bozja.
A set of rusted armor used in ancient Bozja.
Several parchment bills notarized by the gleaners' guildship stating the reward for the slaying of certain specimens. (Average difficulty: ★)
Several parchment bills notarized by the gleaners' guildship stating the reward for the slaying of certain specimens. (Average difficulty: ★★)
Several parchment bills notarized by the gleaners' guildship stating the reward for the slaying of certain specimens. (Average difficulty: ★★★)
A parchment bill notarized by the gleaners' guildship stating the reward for the slaying of a certain notorious and deadly specimen.
A hastily written note which reads “Vaindreau found unconscious at Providence Point.”
A hastily written note which reads “Airship sighted flying low near Camp Dragonhead.”
A hastily written note which reads “Vaindreau not dressed for the cold.”
Created by an Archon who devoted himself to the study of sustenance, this bread, infused with pulverized fish and vegetables, is extremely nutritious...assuming one can get past the taste.
A letter addressed to Hinageshi. The untidy handwriting betrays how nervous Tankin was when penning it.
A medicine made from the glimshroom which cures the Creeping Death.
A sacred branch from the Guardian Tree, bequeathed by the great one.
A tome that lends its reader a great deal of insight into gigantic telescopes and their history.
A tome that covers the various types of telescopes and how they are structured.
A tome that speaks on the ever-elusive starlens.
Though its contents neither verify nor disprove your suspicions, this letter was almost certainly penned by a now-deceased member of the Crania Lupi.
The outer edge is covered in myriad scuffs and scratches, while the inner is marked with only a name and date, carefully engraved.
The weight of the words within is almost tangible, in addition to the weight of the paper itself.
A vial of some unidentifiable substance prepared by the Ul'dahn Alchemists' Guild.
A sturdy sack large enough to contain one standard-sized coblyn.
This sturdy sack contains one subdued, standard-sized coblyn.
An in-depth dissertation on the merits and limitations of Ishgardian astrology as compiled by Jannequinard de Durendaire.
Penned by the young Honoroit Banlardois, this account records all the sights and sounds of his journey throughout the Sea of Clouds in exquisitely accurate detail.
The quintessential travel journal of the Auri wanderer, Hoelun. Its pages paint an evocative picture of the Azim Steppe and the rich culture of its native tribes.
This lifelike stuffed toy appears ready to scamper away at any moment. Thankfully, it lacks the aetherial energy to do so.
Apparently powerful enough to destroy rocks, but safe enough for a child to use.
The message written on this envelope indicates it is meant to be delivered to the Confluence.
The perfect candle for long nights of study.
The existence of this mammet is probably a secret best kept from certain individuals.
The decaying remains of a fallen tree.
A generous hunk of glistening flesh, sure to sate the appetite of even the most voracious carnivore.
While the color suggests mud, the odor suggests something else entirely...
Whoever drew this has a bright future as an illustrator of fungi.
So long as the illustration was accurate, this must be sample 316. Or close enough, at any rate.
A sack containing fruit grown at Meryall Agronomics. The smell emanating from it defies definition of its contents.
A wheel of lustering cheese. The smell emanating from it defies definition of its ingredients.
While instructions are not included, Jonquinet seems confident that they will not prove necessary.
Notes concerning the massive inventory operation that is currently underway in Labyrinthos.
Notes concerning the large quantities of cargo making its way in and out of Labyrinthos.
Notes concerning exhausting work causing accidents, such as a gleaner inadvertently freeing a pack of marmots.
A sturdy sack, supposedly large enough to hold one or more squirming marmots.
This sack holds the plump, wriggling form of one greatly annoyed grizzled mouse.
Paper made from this lumber will feed the insatiable machine of progress.
Only the most inspired of treatises are worthy to be inked upon the paper made from lumber of this quality.
The watercress is said to fortify the body against sickness, and is an essential part of any well-rounded diet.
While this branch appears to be no different than any other, a more discerning eye may be able to find a sign of insect life.
This branch is crawling with bugs of all sorts─a veritable menagerie of insect life.
Grass picked from the fields of Thavnair. Its nutritional value is a subject of much debate.
The vibrant color of this grass is enough to make one jealous of the yakow's diet.
A single sniff of the contents of this pouch is enough to bring tears to the eyes.
While the suitability of palm oil for fuel is still uncertain, this bottle should be kept away from open flames.
To the untrained eye this beet is much like any other, but an inspired mind may be able to make an unforgettable dish from it.
This beet deserves to be put on display, but failing that, it could be the cornerstone of an unforgettable repast.
With luck, this branch will be the beginning of a great forest that will endure for generations.
Within these burnt remains may lie the secret to the hardiness of Garlemald's flora.
Somehow, this tree has survived the fires of war, and even continues to flourish. Unlocking the secrets of its hardiness may be a boon for progress.
The most vital ingredient in the Last Stand's famous chai, the exact location of this cinnamon is a closely guarded secret.
The fabled herbs of the Near East are sometimes mistaken for trees, and many researchers have wondered at the secret behind their growth.
Although this sago palm appears fit to eat, without the proper precautions it could very well be one's final meal.
More than one hungry soul has met their end by biting into a sago palm before the arduous process of preparing it for consumption was complete.
The plants of Labyrinthos are not only for show─these ones might be used by a skilled weaver to craft all manner of garb.
Garments crafted with these plants may very well be exquisite enough to make the most dapper dandy green with envy.
Not even the secrets of the Tenkonto can stay hidden from the relentless pursuit of trial and error.
This sap is said to possess almost mythical medicinal properties.
The efficacy of this shimmering sap in the treatment of illnesses is a subject of much debate, but none disagree that it is pleasing to the eyes.
Something about this stone sets it apart from the others. You could stare at it for bells...
This stone makes all others look like clods of dirt. You are almost loath to part with it, so precious it appears to be.
One of the many uses for silica is to repair the workshops of overzealous researchers when their experiments do not go as planned.
A sample containing the selfsame soil that is used throughout Labyrinthos.
Lush samples of soil will help researchers more accurately pinpoint the source of inequities in aetherial density.
Acquiring giantsgall is no small challenge, but the mineral is highly prized for its high concentration of aether, even in smaller quantities.
The aether suffuse in this sample of giantsgall is sure to fuel many nights of fevered research.
Limestone is often used to enrich soil, and it is said that it has made many a barren field fertile once again.
Giantsgall is favored by alchemists for its aetheric density, but all too few have taken the time to appreciate its outer beauty.
The Mark XLIX passenger train is said to be nigh indestructible, its armor affording the utmost protection to the vaunted guests it shuttles to and fro.
The secrets of Garlean engineering lie waiting to be uncovered within this pitiless slab of metal.
Gazing at this stone evokes desolate tundras, chill winds, and forlorn hope.
The ceruleum engine is a work of unfathomable complexity, and many have tried but failed to match their efficiency.
Upon countless components just like these was the engine of empire built.
You fail to find words that could give even a fraction of the inspiration the sight of this porous rock bestows.
This sand is soft and smooth—a far cry from the type that stings eyes and irritates skin.
Some farmers have been known to mix stone powder and other materials into their soil to increase the variety of crops they can grow.
This powder catches the light in way that suggests it is rich with nutrients.
It seems as if the entirety of nature's beauty has been captured and imbued into this singular mineral.
Within this mineral is contained the unbound joy of existence, and a love so deep it could swallow oceans. One only need gaze into its surface to find them...
This mineral is common throughout Labyrinthos, but it takes great effort to extract any worthwhile quantity from the bedrock.
A sample of soil from the Central Circuit. Aether levels in the area must be measured to determine the influence of the elemental reactors.
A rich sample of soil from the Central Circuit, which will surely speed along the survey of aether levels in the area.
While it seems that one of these is more than sufficient for a necklace, there's no point in questioning orders.
A chunk of meat, freshly cut and ready to be tossed in a stew.
Made with only the finest and freshest ingredients, this amra-flavored lassi is boasted to settle unruly stomachs.
Having exhausted all of its aether, the drunken deepa is now having a well-earned rest.
A hempen sack filled to the brim with chunks of the purest giantsgall.
A bit longer and this box would have been lost to the sea.
A sack that almost met a watery end after being flung from its transport.
Prepared by the Great Work alchemists, this oil can be used to reinforce the points and edges of stonecutting tools.
A razor-sharp blade carved from giantsgall.
A small pile of bark shaved from a hillside tree.
Sheet metal from Naldiq & Vymelli's.
Heavy and full, this pouch is ready to be exchanged for precious crystals.
A pouch filled with valuable gemstones.
The hamsa accepts its capture without so much as a chirp of protest, its eyes vacant and trusting.
A strong, sweet aroma drifts from this bottle.
A particularly big and juicy amra at peak ripeness.

Although this morsel would have been perfectly edible had it not been marinated in sleeping potion, using it as bait to snare a bear will provide valuable sustenance for the whole Ilsabard contingent. Should the plan fail, however, not only will this prime venison have gone to waste, you will most likely be dead.
Though the bag is on the smaller side, its heft and weight mean it is filled nigh to bursting with buckwheat seeds.
The smell of this liquid is said to repel wild creatures. Ineffective against hamsa and adventurers.
A large─and apparently freshly laid─hamsa egg.
Produces a warming sensation upon consumption, thanks to a few special ingredients, which may or may not include fearsomely strong cider...
A chain forged of that unique Garlean steel and strong enough to bind a magna roader.
A malicious automated roader quelled by a great adventurer and ensnared by a cermet chain.
Though its contents have either evaporated or been consumed, the bracing scent of liquor remains.
Its contents have since been either used or spilled, but lean in close enough and one can still detect faint whiffs of what once was.
A now-wrinkled piece of paper upon which a person composed what was likely their final words.
Pillaged from warmachina, this canister of ceruleum can likely be repurposed for less destructive means.
This powder is so potent it petrifies positively any persons purblind enough to provoke this poison's possessor.
A broth of Ermiance's design. Few are those who can resist its delectable scent and inviting curls of steam.
A blasting agent packed with enough powder to send debris flying into next sennight.
Exceptionally strong spirits of which many Garleans have partaken. Guaranteed to put hair on one's chest...if it doesn't knock one out cold first.
A chunk of almasty practically dripping with the creature's blood.
Imperial weaponry that has been kicked to the side and subsequently forgotten following the truce.
A worn trinket carved from giantsgall.
A cage containing foolish fish who took the bait.
The still-warm corpse of a guhasaya, slain but moments ago.
Scales from a long-lived pisaca, much sought after for their unusual hardness.
Herbalists insist this leaf can settle the stomach before any embarrassing incidents occur.
The roots of the singabera raise the body's temperature, fortifying it against poison and illness.
These leaves help soothe anxious hearts and calm troubled minds.
This sack is large enough to hold several snakelike creatures in it.
The bhujamga within this sack is sleeping soundly, but it may be best to tread carefully while you hold it.
Although this bhujamga is dead, it may be advisable to stay away from its fangs.

These enchanted talismans─or should that be “talismen”?─would probably require considerably less time and effort to produce if the alchemists of the Great Work were not so preoccupied with making them look pretty.

Being gifts from the notoriously unreliable Emmanellain, it is highly doubtful this concoction will have the intended effect. If only there were willing─and more importantly, unwitting─volunteers on whom to test it...

Uncovering hidden treasure is an adventurer's bread and butter, though one is not normally required to go elbow-deep in ice-cold, stagnant pond water to retrieve it. Nevertheless, many would choose that over mowing down hordes of slavering beasts or solving annoying puzzles.
Powerful enough to destroy the thick armor of imperial warmachina, but not the considerably more fragile ceruleum tanks beneath, apparently.

Not only did this tank survive the attack that disabled the warmachina in which it was installed, it also escaped the blast of your explosives unscathed. If medals for outstanding service were awarded to inanimate objects, this champion among ceruleum tanks would surely deserve one.
Aetherially treated chain capable of binding even the wriggliest of opponents.
Woven from aether, the strength of this rope directly corresponds to that of its user.
Duly weakened and carefully bound, this petalouda is destined to become clothing.
Using this concept crystal, anyone can harness lightning regardless of spellcasting skill.
A scintillating crystal, upon which is stored some manner of esoteric concept.
Even Viera are like to swoon at the sight of so grand a carrot. That or be offended by all those who assume that they would.
A mug of piping hot chai brewed from aromatic tea leaves, flavored with Nidhana's secret blend of herbs and spices, then mixed with rich milk.
The nature of this paperwork is not a particularly well-guarded secret─but due to how dull it is to read, will nevertheless remain largely unknown.
A small box found submerged at the bottom of the Font of Maya.
A small key found in the Font of Maya.
This parchment contains a cryptic message, written in a hurried hand.
A military-grade philter with uncommon restorative properties.

A grade-13 map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 90 recommended.

A grade-14 map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.

A faded map revealing the location of a teleportation portal leading to a hidden stage filled with untold riches.

※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.
A small statue depicting a figure with the body of a woman and the head of a beast.
Though it looks like a cookie, smells like a cookie, and is certainly called a cookie, it may be no mere cookie...
The daidalion puts a great deal of effort into hiding its eggs from predators. Unfortunately, it reckoned without your ability to locate hidden objects with laser-like precision.
This crystal allows even the most aether-poor creatures to dispel illusory magicks.
Whatever this icky globule is, it came from an eidos.
A crystalline core obtained from a slain luminion.
A red flower that presumably once flourished on the Dragonstar.
A white flower that presumably once flourished on the Dragonstar.
One of the observational records with which the ophiotauroi so uncouthly absconded.
One way or another, this oreias has been rendered unconscious and can be safely transported.
As the program installed on this all-purpose storage and operations device is not currently functional, it is difficult to tell what it does.
No troll can resist a fruit this ripe─in more than one way, according to your olfactory senses.
This experimental concoction is meant to intenerate even the hardest of seedkin casings─“meant to” being the operative phrase.
The gnawed remains of a once-proud iron carrot.
Created by a man named Hypnos, this potion boasts powerful sleep-inducing properties.
A concoction capable of turning anything into a desiccated husk. Swallowing it would be a terrible idea.
This mysterious length of rope is perfect for the binding of fiends. Also makes for a marvelous jump rope.
Watching this poor bryon struggle weakly against its bindings certainly tugs at the heartstrings... Oh well! Better it than you, right?
This unique case is designed specifically for the capture of rogue dolls which just so happen to be sentient. Its specificity has meant it has long been sitting unused, gathering dust.
This coffer has at long last fulfilled its purpose by capturing a mammet. If a box could have feelings, this one would be proud.
Time is apparently of the essence, so you had best not spend too long examining this complex machine part...or attempting to read a detailed description of said machine part.
A small and somehow familiar device for recording combat data.
A device containing data from your fight against the Omicron aggressor. For some reason, the screen reads “Lv. 90” and its speakers are emitting a jaunty tune.
A simple-yet-stylish handmade coinpurse stuffed to the brim with gil.
A sturdy leather bag filled to near-bursting with hamsa eggs.
A compact receptacle ideal for providing nourishment to diminutive hamsa.
A high-capacity sack suited for providing nourishment to more sizable hamsa.
This simple-yet-elegant wristband symbolizes the eternal bond between husband and wife.
A letter from the alchemist Jalzahn addressed to the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya. The bold, sweeping penmanship is a clear sign that its author has a high opinion of himself.
A letter from the alchemist Ardashir addressed to House Balyk. The penmanship is elegant, yet reserved.
A sticky and highly corrosive substance secreted by acidic mousse, though apparently not quite corrosive enough to melt your hands when you scooped it up.
A bag containing powder made from an obscure herb. Simply sniffing it makes you drowsy.
When books are closed, what do they dream of?
A metal vessel used for making sweets.
This cookbook contains a collection of sweets recipes conceived by the legendary culinarian Dellemont.
So fresh, you would swear it's still warm.
The riddles in this letter lead to the keys needed to open the locked box.
It is quite possible the key itself is more valuable than the contents of the box it opens.
A healthy bulb certain to grow into a gorgeous flower.
Lovingly made at the Last Stand, this sandwich is fairly bursting with the freshest seasonal vegetables.
Made from Elpis-grown fruit and flowers, the aroma of this aether-rich concoction promises a uniquely complex flavor.
A pale red herb which is said to have powerful medicinal properties.
A jewel with subtle gold decorations. It appears it was once set in something.
This bloom appears to be edible despite not being a lifelike sugar-laden confectionery.
A healthy dose of aether-rich energy. Not to be administered orally.
This shard of elemental moisture is surprisingly solid to the touch.
These documents contain sensitive information pertaining to development schedules and implementation particulars.
If only the sweet smell of these flowers was enough to soothe their savage saplings... Alas.
A beautiful and ancient predecessor to the modern lily.
A crystal imbued with hope for a safe journey.
Monsters are driven away by the pungent smell wafting from this noxious mixture.
One can only speculate what's inside this bottle-shaped package.
A medicine meant to revitalize the exhausted.
This crystal reacts in the presence of gem-based arcane entities.
Said to have been found roaming alone in the wilds, this Carbuncle looks oddly familiar...
The horrid stench of this no-doubt potent potion is enough to burn one's nose hairs clean off.
Made of thick, sturdy material, this bag muffles all sounds, including the horrific screams of captured vegetables. Convenient!
You can feel how this sentient tomato struggles to escape its confines. Luckily this sack muffles its piercing screams.
A skillfully painted portrait of a smiling man and wife cradling their newborn babe. Perfect for grandmothers.
This smells about as terrible as you might imagine─perhaps worse.
Apples of a size so gargantuan, you find your gorge rising a little. A shame, since apples are a rather innocuous fruit, really.
Concocted to soothe a skatene's unblinking eyes, which can get terribly dry from glaring menacingly at passersby.
Given the soma's frigid physique, it is somewhat difficult to distinguish between the parts that are ice crystals, and those that are merely ice.
The first part of a manuscript regarding the construction of Sharlayan's great device for peering into the aetherial sea.
The second part of a manuscript regarding the construction of Sharlayan's great device for peering into the aetherial sea.
An account of the process of building Sharlayan's starship.
A core brutally ripped out of a center anila. You cannot think of how such a thing would be used in space travel, but you are not being paid to think.
Coarse sand obtained from the lunar surface.
A bunch of carrot seeds just begging to be planted.
A freshly harvested carrot guaranteed to make one forget life's woes.
This unit wants it. This unit needs it.
What remains of the Omicron's consort after it self-destructed.
Filled to the brim with deadly toxin, and smells of it, too.
Run-of-the-mill limestone that will nevertheless produce the desired chemical reaction.
A core brutally ripped out of an anala.
A core filled with ice-aspected aether.
Taken from the marvelously vibrant bird of Elpis, these feathers boast all the colors of the rainbow.
The ripe, acid-covered, and unsettlingly familiar fruit of a plant creation.
Applied to the skin, this balm protects from caustic substances.
Made by braiding together aether itself, this rope is more than capable of restraining diminutive and docile creatures such as the agavoides.
A gift of fruit left for you by the indescribably uncanny creation Notos 666.
Even though standard, non-aetheric rope would probably be more than sufficient, when dealing with lethal snakelike creatures, it is best to err on the side of caution.

The Warrior of Light is possessed of many talents mystical and strange. The ability to smuggle gigantic scalekin on their person without so much as a suspicious bulge, however, is perhaps strangest of them all...
As if to confirm your suspicion that crystals are at the center of every facet of existence, this pattern from which life is conjured has also been wrought of crystal.
If the pungent aroma is any indication, this fruit is likely to provide a unique─if not especially pleasant─culinary experience.
This floral water is both fragrant and tasty─not that you would know.
Coagulated aether found floating near the Twelve Wonders.
This information on the efficacy of stinging invertebrates' defense mechanisms is either fascinating or terrifying, depending on who you ask.
This vague information about a plant that bears poison fruit bears further investigating─by someone who cares.
In retrospect, you really ought to have expected to hear about morbols and their noble lineage when you took this assignment.
A thin rope woven from aether.
Aetheric rope holds this restless conceptual plant captive.
A bag full of bugs and shellfish for the young Zephyros 72s.
It's calmed down after eating its fill.
You're certain you've seen these somewhere in the Sea of Clouds.
This crystal appears sensitive to a specific kind of aether.
This delicate bloom has been imbued with a specific trace of aether.
A new type of flower with large, yellow petals.
This tome contains all sorts of fascinating information about Ktisis Hyperboreia's naming protocols.
This crystal allows even the most aether-poor creatures to cast destructive spells.
A chunk of ore from Kallimelios Zephyros that is particularly useful in measuring environmental aether.
This model of a two-legged shark species looks terribly familiar...
A root vegetable with such an uncommon luster that one might think, “Oh, that's not edible.” Not only is it safe for consumption, but it imparts joy to those who have partaken of it.
Watching it rest its eyes, you might be convinced that this creature is placid and well behaved. You would be wrong. And frankly, you should know better.
A sampling of filament taken from sentient fungi found on the moon.
A crystal infused with lightning-aspected aether, courtesy of the Carrotorium.
A crystal infused with wind-aspected aether, courtesy of the Carrotorium.
There's nothing in it.
A bottle full of cool, clear water.
This was a daphnia until it met a hunter.
A budding flower found on the moon.
A shining flower from the moon.
A strange moon flower, if it is a flower at all.
A flower taken from atop the head of a lunatender.
A flower with red petals, said to be favored by the divine Manusya.
A flower with orange petals, said to be favored by the divine Mrga.
A key component in any ceruleum engine that works properly.
A message addressed to Volusus.
Securely bound, this agavoides young isn't going anywhere you're not.
A metal container containing a hearty serving of curry. Still warm to the touch.
A potent healing salve made by the alchemists of the Great Work.
This mass of nerve tissue procured from an other one still pulsates unsettlingly in your hands.
A length of mysterious pulsating cord fashioned to subdue and capture noncorporeal entities.
All that remains of an unfortunate Ea who wandered too far from the abode, and in doing so lost what little remained of themselves.
This creation concept has been certified for release into the wider world.
A mysterious length of tightly woven material crafted of aether and perfect for the binding of runaway creatures.
A lost charybdis bound by an aetheric rope. Now, at last, it can find its way home.
A forbidden research log detailing an advanced method for manipulating rift-spanning apertures as devised by Nuhashahn, the ninth patriarch of House Daemir.
A flask filled with astrally infused water scooped from a strangely specific point in the depths of the Font of Maya.
An ambitious stack of homemade adverts created with little skill, but lots of heart.
An embroidered pouch that somehow feels too plentiful with coin to have been acquired honestly.
A pungent sack of unidentifiable substance, the sale of which may or may not be prohibited by law.
This heavy box bears an insignia strikingly similar to Naldiq & Vymelli's.
A healthy handful of robust and gnarly plant tendrils.
A copy of a sacred text of the Fist of Rhalgr, faithfully transcribed from the original.
Even an incurable optimist would feel compelled to say that this waterskin is nearly empty.
A deep green blossom said to be beloved by Sanduruva.
Handcrafted from soap nuts to meet the specialized needs of hippo skin. Guarantees a fresh hippo every time.
Wild grass native to the southern banks of Ksiroda─and a delightful snack for hippos.
While a sensible person would not dare consume flesh in this state, any respectable pisaca would happily queue for but a nibble.
Pewter scales perfect for filing hard substances.
A sharp blade suited for all manner of work, bloody or otherwise.
While the sap contained within this...container has an alluring luster, it is known more for its utility than its flavor.
These explosives must be handled with the same care with which they were crafted─or, given the proclivities of Hannish alchemists, perhaps more.
The only thing remarkable about this mud is its unusual hardness.
The chip off this monster's hide has a surprisingly heady aroma.
Don't bring this moss near hippos without the utmost confidence in your ability to outrun them.
The contents of this sack could pay for a whole month of revelry and debauchery, with plenty left over afterward.
Although the crate itself is soaked, there is still hope for the contents to be dry.
Fish are a staple of many a cuisine, but perhaps none favor them more so than the realm's crustaceans.
While these legs have been known to bear industrious fishers to great fortune, more than a few have lost their lives trying to acquire them.
A hemp bag filled to bursting with the plentiful returns of some very dedicated hamsa.
So named for the delicate fronds curling from its center like a thriving, scarlet blossom.
A metal container filled with warm, homemade food─complete with a small bottle of chai.
A large, succulent amra.
A bag filled with dismembered flora and fauna alike. ...Best not to think too hard about it.
The recipe of this curative tonic is a cherished secret of the vaunted House Daemir.
A particularly smelly seed, now prevented from maturing into a particularly smelly asvattha.
A woven sack perfectly designed for holding and transporting hippo food.
A potent explosive whipped up by Nashu with the power to jog one's memories.
A brightly glowing spirit vessel that currently houses the resolute spirit of Inspector Hildibrand.
A warm meal made with care by the workers of the Last Dregs.
A moisture-sealed body bag provided by the Omicrons to prevent Grebuloffs from sleeping with the fishes. Literally, but mostly figuratively.
A moisture-sealed body bag stuffed with a Grebuloff. How you're able to carry it is perhaps better left unexplained.
A sturdy hempen sack of the sort typically filled with heavy chunks of ore.
An Amalj'aa-style ritual incense burner filled with fragrant myrrh.
This sturdy container is almost certain not to leak any volatile substances held within, resulting in a conflagration of untold destruction.
Filled to the brim with ceruleum. Mishandling of this container may result in severe burns or the death of your loved ones.
A colorful decoration crucial to Hatching-tide festivities.
Having run off, this prototype machine subsequently ceased to function.
A box of carrot-shaped canisters filled with highly flammable liquid.
A tantalizingly sweet aroma wafts from this neatly packaged serving of carrot steak.
A perfect model of compact gentlemanliness, this mammet's clothes can be donned or doffed with the press of a button.
From Etheirys, with love.
Curated by Archmagus Noah herself, this collection of gear has everything a daring adventurer would need to brave the nighted halls of Eureka Orthos.
An antique folding fan Aldiytha found within the Thorne manor, crafted in a style used during the Thorne Dynasty.
A map potentially revealing the location of treasure. ※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.
A faded map potentially revealing the location of a teleportation portal leading to a hidden stage filled with untold riches. ※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.

A grade-15 map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 90 recommended.

A faded map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.
The glistening liver of a Saltwind's Welcome kacchapa.
A handmade figurine with an inscrutably charming aspect.
A small sample of supremely stimulating seasoning.
Adorned with a hand-drawn picture of a chocobo, this letter invites adventurers to take part in an exploratory expedition.
A map that could conceivably lead you to treasure. If you fancy that sort of thing. ※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.

A faded map that conceivably reveals the location of a teleportation that will convey you to another location, whereupon you might possibly gain riches beyond your wildest imaginings. Maybe. ※Level 90 full party (8 players) recommended.
A package containing a gift from the orphans living in Terncliff.
Though woven by small hands, this accessory was created with big heart.
Etched into woven strips of leather are the names of four lads forever friends.
A peculiar statue carved in the likeness of a sparrow.
A small crustacean that burrows under the sands in certain south sea isles.
A small worm that slithers about the rocks of certain south sea isles.
An aetherial wave amplifier in the shape of a carrot developed—or perhaps cultivated—by Singingway.
A horn of unknown origin said to manifest an entity which corresponds to the desires of its wielder.
A peculiar statue carved in the likeness of a turtle.
A peculiar statue carved in the likeness of a whale.
A bundle of garments fit for tropical climes, handpicked by Tataru.
A comprehensive report detailing Vylbrand's every waterway.
Even for those without Iq Soq Xmajun's heightened olfactory senses, the aroma is quite overpowering.
A basket of standard-quality wool you received from Tobli. Worth one pel in the hundreds column.
A finely crafted hatchet you received in trade for a wool poncho. Worth one pel in the thousands column.
A sizable pile of freshly harvested mate leaves.
A large sack of premium mate leaves you received in trade for a fine hatchet and an investment of labor. Worth five pel in the thousands column.
The brisk breeze emanating from this wind crystal can be used to fill sails or cool stuffy workshops.
This pungent punutiy feed contains a mix of aquatic plants and vegetable scraps.
A sturdy poncho you received in trade for a basket of alpaca wool. Worth five pel in the hundreds column.
A high-quality jug of mezcal you received in trade for premium mate leaves, an introductory letter, and the swift culling of hostile pests. Worth ten pel in the thousands column.
A tool used by gleaners to identify certain geological properties.
A softly glowing remnant of an ancient meteor shower.
Found blooming among the floating isles above Eorzea, the petals of this dandelion glow almost as brillianty as the sun which nourishes them.
So pungent that not a sealed vial can contain its scent completely, a single whiff of this saliva can wrench even the deepest sleeper back into the waking world.
A green-glowing rock containing what appears to be abokixa.
Shoal iwamushi are reportedly attracted to anything that glitters─including this gravel.
This cluster of quartz possesses a light golden hue.
This is what it smells like when trees cry.
While ropes aren't often used to capture plant life, sometimes there's only one tool available.
Not even an aurochs could break free from the knots binding this morbol seedling.
A symbol of trust bestowed upon you by Bakool Ja Ja. Its blend of Hoobigo and Boonewa coloring makes its origin indisputable.
A rare horn possessing potent antidotal properties.
